Class Reporter

java.lang.Object
ca.yorku.cmg.cnsim.engine.reporter.Reporter
public class Reporter extends Object
Provides centralized measurement and reporting for simulations.

The Reporter class is designed to be used via its static methods and handles the creation, logging, and flushing of simulation data for different categories:

  • Events: Records every processed event.
  • Transactions: Records every transaction arrival.
  • Nodes: Records information about each node in the simulation, typically at the end.
  • Network events: Records network link events or bandwidth changes.
  • Beliefs: Records nodes' beliefs about transactions, including optional short-format reports.
  • Errors: Records runtime errors or issues during simulation execution.
Additional reporting (e.g., structure or custom metrics) can be implemented in other classes.

The class manages the log data in ArrayList structures and flushes them to files when requested. Log files are created in a simulation-specific directory, based on the configuration properties and a timestamped run identifier.

Reporting can be selectively enabled or disabled per category using the static setter methods: reportEvents(boolean), reportTransactions(boolean), reportNodes(boolean), reportNetEvents(boolean), reportBeliefs(boolean), and reportBeliefsShort(boolean).

All flush methods write the corresponding log to a CSV file (or TXT for errors) in the simulation output directory. File names include the run identifier to ensure uniqueness.

The class is thread-unsafe; concurrent modifications to log data should be externally synchronized if multiple threads may report simultaneously.

Author:
Sotirios Liaskos for the Conceptual Modeling Group @ York University

      Returns:
      true if event reporting is enabled, false otherwise

      public static String getRunId()

    • addEvent

      public static void addEvent(int simID, long evtID, long simTime, long sysTime, String evtType, int nodeInvolved, long objInvolved, String misc)
      Adds an entry to the event log with information about the event.
      Parameters:
      simID - The simulation ID.
      evtID - The event ID.
      simTime - The simulation time at which the event occurred.
      sysTime - The system time at which the event was processed.
      evtType - A string describing the type of event.
      nodeInvolved - The ID of the node involved in the event, or -1 if none.
      objInvolved - The ID of the object involved in the event (e.g., transaction ID), or -1 if none.

    • addTx

      public static void addTx(int simID, long txID, float size, float value, int nodeID, long simTime)
      Adds a transaction entry to the transaction log.
      Parameters:
      simID - Simulation ID
      txID - Transaction ID
      size - Transaction size in bytes TODO: verify it is bytes
      value - Transaction value in tokens
      nodeID - The ID of the node at which the transaction first arrives.
      simTime - Simulation time of arrival

    • addTx

      public static void addTx(int simID, long txID, float size, float value, int nodeID, long simTime, int conflictID)
      Adds a transaction entry to the transaction log including the ID of the transaction with which the transaction in question conflicts.
      Parameters:
      simID - Simulation ID
      txID - Transaction ID
      size - Transaction size in bytes TODO: verify it is bytes
      value - Transaction value in tokens
      nodeID - The ID of the node at which the transaction first arrives.
      simTime - Simulation time of arrival
      conflictID - The transaction ID with which the current transaction conflicts.

    • addTx

      public static void addTx(int simID, long txID, float size, float value, int nodeID, long simTime, int conflictID, String dependencies)
      Adds a transaction entry to the transaction log including the ID of the transaction with which the transaction in question conflicts.
      Parameters:
      simID - Simulation ID
      txID - Transaction ID
      size - Transaction size in bytes TODO: verify it is bytes
      value - Transaction value in tokens
      nodeID - The ID of the node at which the transaction first arrives.
      simTime - Simulation time of arrival
      conflictID - The transaction ID with which the current transaction conflicts.
      dependencies - a string of the form {txID1,txID2,...} specifying the transactions on which the current transaction depends. -1 if the transaction has no dependencies.

    • addNode

      public static void addNode(int simID, int nodeID, float hashPower, float electricPower, float electricityCost, double totalCycles)
      Adds a node entry to the node log.
      Parameters:
      simID - Simulation ID
      nodeID - Node ID
      hashPower - Hashing power in GH/s
      electricPower - Electric power usage in Watts
      electricityCost - Electricity cost in USD/kWh
      totalCycles - Total hash cycles performed by the node

    • addNetEvent

      public static void addNetEvent(int simID, int from, int to, float bandwidth, long simTime)
      Adds an entry to the network log with information about an event that establishes or updates the bandwidth between two nodes. For static networks only initial network creation is reported here. For dynamic networks any change in the bandwidth between two nodes is reported. Zero bandwidth means no link.
      Parameters:
      simID - The simulation ID.
      from - The node from which the link is established
      to - The node to which the link is established
      bandwidth - The speed of the link
      simTime - The time at which the event happened

    • addBeliefEntry

      public static void addBeliefEntry(int simID, int node, long tx, float degBelief, long simTime)
      Adds an entry to the belief log with information about a node's belief on a transaction.
      Parameters:
      simID - The simulation ID.
      node - The node ID expressing the belief.
      tx - The transaction ID about which the belief is expressed.
      degBelief - The degree of belief (e.g., 1 for believes, 0 for does not believe).
      simTime - The simulation time at which the belief is recorded.

    • addErrorEntry

      public static void addErrorEntry(String errorMsg)
      Adds an entry to the error log.
      Parameters:
      errorMsg - The custom error message.

    • addExecTimeEntry

      public static void addExecTimeEntry(int simID, long simTime, long sysStartTime, long sysEndTime, long numScheduled, long numProcessed)
      Adds an entry to the execution time log with information about the simulation run time.
      Parameters:
      simID - The simulation ID.
      simTime - The total simulation time.
      sysStartTime - The system start time of the simulation run.
      sysEndTime - The system end time of the simulation run.
      numScheduled - The number of events scheduled during the simulation.
      numProcessed - The number of events processed during the simulation.

    • flushAll

      public static void flushAll()
      Flushes (writes out and clears) all report buffers maintained by the simulation reporting subsystem.

      This method triggers the flush operations for all built-in report categories, including event, input, node, network, belief, error, and configuration reports. It also invokes flushCustomReports() to handle any user-defined or extension reports.

      This method is final to ensure that subclasses cannot override it and potentially skip mandatory flush operations.

      Implementation detail: This method delegates to specific flush methods for each report type. Subclasses should extend reporting functionality through flushCustomReports(), not by overriding this method.

    • flushCustomReports

      public static void flushCustomReports()
      Flushes any custom or extension-specific reports defined outside the core reporting system.

      This method is a no-op by default but may be extended to include additional report flush operations specific to custom modules or simulations.

      Implementation detail: Subclasses or extensions may override this method to implement their own flushing behavior for additional report types.

    • flushEvtReport

      public static void flushEvtReport()
      Save reporter's event log to file. File name is "EventLog - [Simulation Date Time].csv"

    • flushInputReport

      public static void flushInputReport()
      Save reporter's transaction log to file. File name is "Input - [Simulation Date Time].csv"

    • flushNodeReport

      public static void flushNodeReport()
      Save reporter's node log to file. File name is "Nodes - [Simulation Date Time].csv"

    • flushNetworkReport

      public static void flushNetworkReport()
      Save reporter's network log to file. File name is "NetLog - [Simulation Date Time].csv"

    • flushBeliefReport

      public static void flushBeliefReport()
      Save reporter's belief log to file. File name is "BeliefLog - [Simulation Date Time].csv"

    • flushErrorReport

      public static void flushErrorReport()
      Save reporter's error log to file. File name is "ErrorLog - [Simulation Date Time].csv"

    • flushExecTimeReport

      public static void flushExecTimeReport()
      Save reporter's execution time log to file. File name is "RunTime - [Simulation Date Time].csv"

    • flushConfig

      public static void flushConfig()
      Export configuration. File name is "Config - [Simulation Date Time].csv"
